alert.note: Alert for Terrell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 25 at 7:49AM CDT until October 26 at 3:23AM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Midland/Odessa TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Independence Creek at Independence Creek near Sheffield, Texas affecting Terrell County. For the Pecos River...including Independence Creek near Sheffield, Texas...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Independence Creek at Independence Creek near Sheffield, Texas. * WHEN...From this morning to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Independence creek threatens the U. S. Highway 285 bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 10.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Below are the latest river stages and forecasts (feet): Fld Observed Wed Wed Thu Thu Location Stg Stg Day/Time 1pm 7pm 1am 7am Independence Creek Independence Creek n 11.0 10.7 Wed 7am 14.0 6.4 6.0 5.7 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 800 PM CDT.
